ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Specify the timeframe (in the past year, past two weeks, etc.) in which elements/items are assessed
During the past 90 days, what symptom(s) have you experienced with regards to marijuana use? The need to smoke more marijuana to achieve the same ''high.''
Notes: 0= No, did not experience symptom; 1= Yes, experienced symptom

ElementDescription: During the past 90 days, what symptom(s) have you experienced with regards to marijuana use? A feeling of being less ''high'' after consistently smoking the same amount of marijuana.
Notes: 0= No, did not experience symptom; 1= Yes, experienced symptom

ElementDescription: During the past 90 days, what symptom(s) have you experienced with regards to marijuana use? Feeling what might be described as a ''withdrawal symptom'' (e.g., sleep disturbance, irritability, etc.).
Notes: 0= No, did not experience symptom; 1= Yes, experienced symptom

ElementDescription: During the past 90 days, what symptom(s) have you experienced with regards to marijuana use? Smoking more marijuana over a period of time than you had originally intended to.
Notes: 0= No, did not experience symptom; 1= Yes, experienced symptom

ElementDescription: During the past 90 days, what symptom(s) have you experienced with regards to marijuana use? A desire to cut back or reduce your marijuana smoking habits.
Notes: 0= No, did not experience symptom; 1= Yes, experienced symptom

ElementDescription: During the past 90 days, what symptom(s) have you experienced with regards to marijuana use? A failure to cut back or reduce your marijuana smoking habits after attempting to do so.
Notes: 0= No, did not experience symptom; 1= Yes, experienced symptom

ElementDescription: During the past 90 days, what symptom(s) have you experienced with regards to marijuana use? Spending a significant amount of time trying to obtain, use, or recover from marijuana.
Notes: 0= No, did not experience symptom; 1= Yes, experienced symptom

ElementDescription: During the past 90 days, what symptom(s) have you experienced with regards to marijuana use? Giving up or reducing important social or work-related activities in order to smoke marijuana.
Notes: 0= No, did not experience symptom; 1= Yes, experienced symptom

ElementDescription: During the past 90 days, what symptom(s) have you experienced with regards to marijuana use? Continuing to smoke marijuana after experiencing a consistent physical or psychological problem that may have been caused by smoking marijuana (e.g., using marijuana despite continuous anxiety attacks that might have been induced by smoking marijuana).
Notes: 0= No, did not experience symptom; 1= Yes, experienced symptom

ElementDescription: During the past 90 days, what symptom(s) have you experienced with regards to marijuana use? Feeling the need to smoke marijuana to avoid experiencing ''withdrawal symptoms.''
Notes: 0= No, did not experience symptom; 1= Yes, experienced symptom

ElementDescription: Marijuana Dependence Scale (MDS) - Number of dependence criteria endorsed
Notes: Number of criteria endorsed, with one of two tolerance or withdrawal items needed for endorsement of that criteria
